answers.answer: Type1 is autoimmune type diabetes.  It may be triggered by an illness or some other unknown factor that triggers a person's immune system to attack it's own pancreas.Type 1 diabetes is not strongly genetically linked.Type 2 diabetes has a very strong genetic link.  IF both parents have diabetes (type 2) the offspring has a very good chance of developing it as well.Diet, weight management, exercise can all go a long way towards delaying the onset of type 2, even if one is predisposed by genetics.

question: For five generations nearly everyone on daddy's side of the family has had type 2 diabetes.  Daddy has been the only type 1.  I know type 2 is genetic and type 1 isn't(I heard it's caused by a virus).  So how did he become type 1?  Quirk of fate?  Or did his family's history of type 2 make him more susceptible to type 1?
title: Why was daddy the only Type 1 in his family?
